RSR3700DR-d-11-25-00-RSR.Narrative: WHEN NORTHBOUND TRAIN WAS PASSING OVER A MAIN LINE SWITCH THE 53RD THROUGH 69TH CARS DERAILED.  ALLDERAILED CARS WERE LOADS OF COAL.  THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE AN IMPROPERLY SECURED MAIN LINE SWITCH.  OUR INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT AN ENGINERING DEPARTMENT EMPLOYEE WHO HAD BEEN WORKING ON THE SWITCH A FEW DAYS BEFORE THE DERAILMENT AND LOST HIS SWITCH KEYS IN THE VISINITY OF THE SWITCH.  EMPLOYEE STATES HE PROPERLY LATCHED THE SWITCH BEFORE HE LEFT THAT DAY.  AFTER DERAILMENT HIS KEYS WERE FOUND IN THE SWITCH LOCK WHICHWAS HANGING OPEN ON THE SWITCH STAND.  THE ROOT CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TOBE AN UNSECURED SWITCH.  WE CANNOT DETERMINE WHETHER OR NOT THE LOST KEYS WERE FOUND BY SOMEONE WHOMAY HAVE UNLATCHED THE SWITCH.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

I0700-d-11-29-00-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0700-d-11-29-00-PATH.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0700-d-11-29-00-PATH.Narrative: AN ENGINEER WAS LAYING UP CARS 616-136-175-640-843-844-767-737.  CAR #737 DERAILED TRAVELING WEST WHILE TRAVERSING THE KINNEY CROSSOVER FROM TRACK H TO TRACK G IN SOUTH STREET YARD.  THE LEAD TRUCK DERAILED ON THE HOUSETOP OF 9W SWITCH.  THE HOUSETOP LOOSENED AND WAS PULLED FREE.  THE HOUSETOP WAS FOUND 10 FEET WEST OF THE SWITCH.  THE POINT OF DERAILMENT WAS ON THE CURVED STOCK RAIL OF 9W SWITCHAT THE #3 ROD.  THE WHEELS DERAILED TO THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE RAIL ON THE INSIDE OF THE TURNOUT.  THEFIRST AXLE WENT ON THE GROUND APPROXIMATELY 11' 2"FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  THE SECOND AXLE WENT ON THE GROUND 28' 6" FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT.  THE WHEELS RODE OVER A SIGNAL TRIPPER ASSEMBLY, AND THE CAR IMPACTED A SIGNAL POLE AND THE CONCRETE GIRDER OF THE KINNEY STREET BRIDGE.  THE CARCAME TO A STOP 250 FEET BEYOND THE POINT OF DERAILMENT. THE TOTAL DAMAGE TO SIGNAL TRACK AND EQUIPMENT WAS ESTIMATED AT $192,834.  FULL ACCOUNTING FOR THE INCIDENT REMAINS PENDING THE ENGINEERING REPORT.  PRELIMINARY DOLLARS REFLECT REPLACEMENT COST.  THE TYPE AND DEGREE OF DAMAGE CORRELATES WITH EXCESSIVE LATERAL FORCES ON THE SWITCH.  THIS MAY BE CAUSED BY SPEED GREATER THAN ALLOWABLE THROUGH THE SWITCH.
